quest.name: Petalouda Hunt
journal: Hythlodaeus is looking you up and down.
objectives: Use the aetheric rope to capture weakened petaloudai.

dialogue.name: EMETSELCH
dialogue.text: In case you didn't know, it's rude to stare. Stop.

dialogue.name: HYTHLODAEUS
dialogue.text: Now then, our friend Hermes. Aside from overseeing the facility, he also conducts his own research.

dialogue.name: HYTHLODAEUS
dialogue.text: Chances are he will be at the main observation hub, so let us seek him out there first.

dialogue.name: HYTHLODAEUS
dialogue.text: Attired as you are, however, you stand out a little too much. Our dear Emet-Selch wishes to keep a low profile for his errand, so...

dialogue.name: HYTHLODAEUS
dialogue.text: Do you know how to make a robe? The basic concept will do.

dialogue.name: HYTHLODAEUS
dialogue.text: No? In that case, Emet-Selch─

dialogue.name: EMETSELCH
dialogue.text: No. Your whim, your responsibility. You're getting not another thimble of aether out of me.

dialogue.name: HYTHLODAEUS
dialogue.text: <sigh> The way he scrimps sometimes, you'd think he wasn't a nigh-bottomless font of magic...

dialogue.name: HYTHLODAEUS
dialogue.text: Very well, I shall make the robe, but perhaps you can assist. Come, let us search for the requisite material.

dialogue.name: EMETSELCH
dialogue.text: No means no. Just be grateful I'm even willing to wait.

dialogue.name: HYTHLODAEUS
dialogue.text: Yes, these creatures should suffice.

dialogue.name: HYTHLODAEUS
dialogue.text: An aetheric rope. I want you to use it to capture, shall we say, two petaloudai.

dialogue.name: HYTHLODAEUS
dialogue.text: There are three species here, I believe. Any two different kinds should serve.

dialogue.name: HYTHLODAEUS
dialogue.text: Now, I should mention that the strength of the rope is tied─no pun intended─to the strength of its user.

dialogue.name: HYTHLODAEUS
dialogue.text: As your aether is still thin compared to ours, you'll need to weaken the petaloudai first. Good luck!

dialogue.name: HYTHLODAEUS
dialogue.text: Remember, it's a pair of petaloudai we require. Any two different kinds should serve.

dialogue.name: HYTHLODAEUS
dialogue.text: You've caught the petaloudai? Come, come, let us see.

dialogue.name: HYTHLODAEUS
dialogue.text: Yes, these fine fellows will do nicely. And now for a spot of reversion...

dialogue.name: HYTHLODAEUS
dialogue.text: ...There! It's ready!

dialogue.name: HYTHLODAEUS
dialogue.text: It's nothing fancy, but then we're trying not to stand out. Try it on for size.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: You turn living beings into clothing? Just like that?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Won't someone be angry with us for using those creatures?

dialogue.name: HYTHLODAEUS
dialogue.text: Well, not just like that. You need to revert them to their constituent aether first.

dialogue.name: HYTHLODAEUS
dialogue.text: Lest you wonder why I asked for two species, it is due to the difference in their aetheric balance. Blending them allows us to produce garb with superior aetheric stability.

dialogue.name: HYTHLODAEUS
dialogue.text: Oh, it's fine, there's no one around to tell us off. And besides, we can always make more petaloudai. They need only a tiny amount of aether.

dialogue.name: HYTHLODAEUS
dialogue.text: It may take some effort to get the form and composition right, but anyone familiar with the concept should be able to manage.

dialogue.name: EMETSELCH
dialogue.text: Well and good to disguise and educate it, but it won't fool anyone who can see worth a damn.

dialogue.name: HYTHLODAEUS
dialogue.text: Fair point, but at the very least it should spare you unwanted attention from casual observers.

dialogue.name: HYTHLODAEUS
dialogue.text: Emet-Selch speaks true. Even dressed like us, your unusual nature will be plain to those who think to look.

dialogue.name: HYTHLODAEUS
dialogue.text: Should someone question your presence, don't make up excuses, much less try to explain what you actually are. No, best to simply say that you're a familiar.

dialogue.name: HYTHLODAEUS
dialogue.text: The question is whose...

dialogue.name: HYTHLODAEUS
dialogue.text: Ah, of course─Azem's. If you say you belong to herhim, people will give you the benefit of the doubt for any and all outlandish behavior.

dialogue.name: EMETSELCH
dialogue.text: Exploiting our associate's absence?

dialogue.name: HYTHLODAEUS
dialogue.text: For lack of herhis presence, absolutely. Were shehe here, shehe'd have been the first to propose the idea─and you know it.

dialogue.name: HYTHLODAEUS
dialogue.text: With that, your story is settled. Let us continue with our errand!
